tags.name: streams
tags.description: Manage Streams, and insert or read data from them

get.description: Lists the streams available to the user.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Only return streams that exactly match the given name.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Skip the first (offset) results. Used together with max for paging.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort the returned results by the given field.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: Control whether the results are sorted in ascending or descending order.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Returns streams that contain the given search term in their name or description.

parameters.name: public
parameters.description: If true, includes publicly available resources in the results.

parameters.name: uiChannel
parameters.description: Filter by whether this stream is an UI channel or not. UI channels are streams used to push updates to visualisation widgets. For the typical list of streams, set this to false.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the stream to be fetched

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the stream to be updated

delete.description: Deletes a stream by id. This will also delete all data for this stream. Use with caution!

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the stream to be deleted

post.description: Add a new event to the stream identified by id. Requires a write permission on the stream.

parameters.name: ttl
parameters.description: Time-To-Live, in seconds. The event will be deleted after this time has passed. If not given, the event storage period will be the stream default.

parameters.name: pkey
parameters.description: For partitioned streams, provides the key to partition by. Can be eg. a customer id to make all events for that customer to go to the same Canvas for processing. If not given, a random partition is selected.

get.summary: Get most recent events from a stream
get.description: Get the N most recent events from a stream.

get.summary: Get events between a range from the stream
get.description: Get events between a range from the stream. The range can be defined in terms of offsets or timestamps, but not both at the same time (fromOffset must be used with toOffset, and fromTimestamp with toTimestamp). In the absence of an upper bound, range will span until latest message. Lower bound is always required, i.e., either fromOffset or fromTimestamp must be present in request.

parameters.name: fromTimestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp lower bound in milliseconds since Jan 1st 1970 UTC

parameters.name: toTimestamp
parameters.description: Timestamp upper bound in milliseconds since Jan 1st 1970 UTC
